title: Additional Resources
content:
Additional Resources
Ports of Code Examples to Other Languages

  Processing (Java) port by Coding Train community
  Python port with pygame by Niklas Hohn
  C++ port with openFrameworks by Jack B. Du
  If you are working on a port, please open an issue on GitHub with links and other relevant information!

Further Reading
Books

  Alexander, R. McNeill. Principles of Animal Locomotion. Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 2002.
  Bentley, Peter. Evolutionary Design by Computers. San Francisco: Morgan Kaufmann Publishers, 1999.
  Braitenberg, Valentino. Vehicles: Experiments in Synthetic Psychology. The MIT Press, 1986
  Bohnacker, Hartmut, Benedikt Gross, Julia Laub, and Claudius Lazzeroni. Generative Design: Visualize, Program, and Create with Processing. New York: Princeton Architectural Press, 2012.
  Eglash, Ron. African Fractals. Rutgers University Press, 1999.
  Flake, Gary William. The Computational Beauty of Nature: Computer Explorations of Fractals, Chaos, Complex Systems, and Adaptation. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press, 1998.
  Hale, Nathan Cabot. Abstraction in Art and Nature. New York: Dover, 1993.
  Hildebrandt, Stefan, and Anthony J. Tromba. Mathematics and Optimal Form. New York: Scientific American Library, 1985. Distributed by W. H. Freeman.
  Kline, Morris. Mathematics and the Physical World. New York: Crowell, [1959].
  Kodicek, Danny. Mathematics and Physics for Programmers. Hingham, MA: Charles River Media, 2005.
  McMahon, Thomas A., and John Tyler Bonner. On Size and Life. New York: Scientific American Library, 1983. Distributed by W. H. Freeman.
  Mandelbrot, Benoit B. The Fractal Geometry of Nature. San Francisco: W. H. Freeman, 1982.
  Onuoha, Mimi, and Mother Cyborg (Diana Nucera). A People's Guide to AI. Allied Media Projects, 2018.
  Pearce, Peter. Structure in Nature Is a Strategy for Design. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press, 1980.
  Pearson, Matt. Generative Art. Greenwich, CT: Manning Publications, 2011. Distributed by Pearson Education.
  Prusinkiewicz, Przemysław, and Aristid Lindenmayer. The Algorithmic Beauty of Plants. New York: Springer-Verlag, 1990.
  Reas, Casey, and Chandler McWilliams. Form+Code in Design, Art, and Architecture. Design Briefs. New York: Princeton Architectural Press, 2010.
  Reas, Casey, and Ben Fry. Processing: A Programming Handbook for Visual Designers and Artists. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press, 2007.
  Resnick, Mitchel. Turtles, Termites, and Traffic Jams: Explorations in Massively Parallel Microworlds. The MIT Press, 1997 .
  Thompson, D’Arcy Wentworth. On Growth and Form: The Complete Revised Edition. New York: Dover, 1992.
  Vogel, Steven. Life in Moving Fluids. Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1994.
  Wade, David. Li: Dynamic Form in Nature. Wooden Books. New York: Walker & Co., 2003.
  Waterman, Talbot H. Animal Navigation. New York: Scientific American Library, 1989. Distributed by W. H. Freeman.
  Whyte, Lancelot Law. Aspects of Form: A Symposium on Form in Nature and Art. Midland Books, MB 31. Bloomington: Indiana University Press, 1966.

Papers and Articles

  Case, Nicky, and Vi Hart. Parable of the Polygons. Blog post. 2014.
  Dawkins, Richard. "The Evolution of Evolvability." In Artificial Life, 20 pages. Routledge, 1989.
  Galanter, Philip. "The Problem with Evolutionary Art Is…" Paper presented at EvoCOMNET’10: The 7th European Event on the Application of Nature-inspired Techniques for Telecommunication Networks and other Parallel and Distributed Systems, April 7-9, 2010.
  Gardner, Martin. "Mathematical Games: The Fantastic Combinations of John Conway’s New Solitaire Game Life." Scientific American 229 (October 1970): 120-23.
  Jakobsen, Thomas. "Advanced Character Physics". 2001 .
  Reeves, William T. "Particle Systems—A Technique for Modeling a Class of Fuzzy Objects." ACM Transactions on Graphics 2:2 (April 1983): 91-108.
  Reynolds, Craig. "Steering Behaviors for Autonomous Characters". Paper presented at SIGGRAPH '99: The 26th Annual Conference on Computer Graphics and Interactive Techniques, Los Angeles, CA, August 8-13, 1999 .
  Sims, Karl. "Artificial Evolution for Computer Graphics." Paper presented at SIGGRAPH '91: The 18th Annual Conference on Computer Graphics and Interactive Techniques, Las Vegas, NV, July 28-August 2, 1991.
  --. "Evolving Virtual Creatures." Paper presented at SIGGRAPH '94: The 21st Annual Conference on Computer Graphics and Interactive Techniques, Orlando, FL, July 24-29, 1994.
  --. "Particle Animation and Rendering Using Data Parallel Computation." Paper presented at SIGGRAPH '90: The 17th Annual Conference on Computer Graphics and Interactive Techniques, Dallas, TX, August 6-10, 1990.
  Sirintronsopon, Wipasinee, Tanaorn Bamroongshawgasame, and Art Gorka. "Fractals in Thai Cultural Designs." Kamnoetvidya Science Academy and Erskine College.
  Tang, Y., Nguyen, D., & Ha, D. "Neuroevolution of Self-Interpretable Agents." Proceedings of the 2020 Genetic and Evolutionary Computation Conference, 414-424.
htmlContent:
Additional Resources

Ports of Code Examples to Other Languages

  • Processing (Java) port by Coding Train community
  • Python port with pygame by Niklas Hohn
  • C++ port with openFrameworks by Jack B. Du
  • If you are working on a port, please open an issue on GitHub with links and other relevant information!

Further Reading

Books

  • Alexander, R. McNeill. Principles of Animal Locomotion. Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 2002.
  • Bentley, Peter. Evolutionary Design by Computers. San Francisco: Morgan Kaufmann Publishers, 1999.
  • Braitenberg, Valentino. Vehicles: Experiments in Synthetic Psychology. The MIT Press, 1986
  • Bohnacker, Hartmut, Benedikt Gross, Julia Laub, and Claudius Lazzeroni. Generative Design: Visualize, Program, and Create with Processing. New York: Princeton Architectural Press, 2012.
  • Eglash, Ron. African Fractals. Rutgers University Press, 1999.
  • Flake, Gary William. The Computational Beauty of Nature: Computer Explorations of Fractals, Chaos, Complex Systems, and Adaptation. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press, 1998.
  • Hale, Nathan Cabot. Abstraction in Art and Nature. New York: Dover, 1993.
  • Hildebrandt, Stefan, and Anthony J. Tromba. Mathematics and Optimal Form. New York: Scientific American Library, 1985. Distributed by W. H. Freeman.
  • Kline, Morris. Mathematics and the Physical World. New York: Crowell, [1959].
  • Kodicek, Danny. Mathematics and Physics for Programmers. Hingham, MA: Charles River Media, 2005.
  • McMahon, Thomas A., and John Tyler Bonner. On Size and Life. New York: Scientific American Library, 1983. Distributed by W. H. Freeman.
  • Mandelbrot, Benoit B. The Fractal Geometry of Nature. San Francisco: W. H. Freeman, 1982.
  • Onuoha, Mimi, and Mother Cyborg (Diana Nucera). A People's Guide to AI. Allied Media Projects, 2018.
  • Pearce, Peter. Structure in Nature Is a Strategy for Design. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press, 1980.
  • Pearson, Matt. Generative Art. Greenwich, CT: Manning Publications, 2011. Distributed by Pearson Education.
  • Prusinkiewicz, Przemysław, and Aristid Lindenmayer. The Algorithmic Beauty of Plants. New York: Springer-Verlag, 1990.
  • Reas, Casey, and Chandler McWilliams. Form+Code in Design, Art, and Architecture. Design Briefs. New York: Princeton Architectural Press, 2010.
  • Reas, Casey, and Ben Fry. Processing: A Programming Handbook for Visual Designers and Artists. Cambridge, MA: MIT Press, 2007.
  • Resnick, Mitchel. Turtles, Termites, and Traffic Jams: Explorations in Massively Parallel Microworlds. The MIT Press, 1997 .
  • Thompson, D’Arcy Wentworth. On Growth and Form: The Complete Revised Edition. New York: Dover, 1992.
  • Vogel, Steven. Life in Moving Fluids. Princeton, NJ: Princeton University Press, 1994.
  • Wade, David. Li: Dynamic Form in Nature. Wooden Books. New York: Walker & Co., 2003.
  • Waterman, Talbot H. Animal Navigation. New York: Scientific American Library, 1989. Distributed by W. H. Freeman.
  • Whyte, Lancelot Law. Aspects of Form: A Symposium on Form in Nature and Art. Midland Books, MB 31. Bloomington: Indiana University Press, 1966.

Papers and Articles

  • Case, Nicky, and Vi Hart. Parable of the Polygons. Blog post. 2014.
  • Dawkins, Richard. "The Evolution of Evolvability." In Artificial Life, 20 pages. Routledge, 1989.
  • Galanter, Philip. "The Problem with Evolutionary Art Is…" Paper presented at EvoCOMNET’10: The 7th European Event on the Application of Nature-inspired Techniques for Telecommunication Networks and other Parallel and Distributed Systems, April 7-9, 2010.
  • Gardner, Martin. "Mathematical Games: The Fantastic Combinations of John Conway’s New Solitaire Game Life." Scientific American 229 (October 1970): 120-23.
  • Jakobsen, Thomas. "Advanced Character Physics". 2001 .
  • Reeves, William T. "Particle Systems—A Technique for Modeling a Class of Fuzzy Objects." ACM Transactions on Graphics 2:2 (April 1983): 91-108.
  • Reynolds, Craig. "Steering Behaviors for Autonomous Characters". Paper presented at SIGGRAPH '99: The 26th Annual Conference on Computer Graphics and Interactive Techniques, Los Angeles, CA, August 8-13, 1999 .
  • Sims, Karl. "Artificial Evolution for Computer Graphics." Paper presented at SIGGRAPH '91: The 18th Annual Conference on Computer Graphics and Interactive Techniques, Las Vegas, NV, July 28-August 2, 1991.
  • --. "Evolving Virtual Creatures." Paper presented at SIGGRAPH '94: The 21st Annual Conference on Computer Graphics and Interactive Techniques, Orlando, FL, July 24-29, 1994.
  • --. "Particle Animation and Rendering Using Data Parallel Computation." Paper presented at SIGGRAPH '90: The 17th Annual Conference on Computer Graphics and Interactive Techniques, Dallas, TX, August 6-10, 1990.
  • Sirintronsopon, Wipasinee, Tanaorn Bamroongshawgasame, and Art Gorka. "Fractals in Thai Cultural Designs." Kamnoetvidya Science Academy and Erskine College.
  • Tang, Y., Nguyen, D., & Ha, D. "Neuroevolution of Self-Interpretable Agents." Proceedings of the 2020 Genetic and Evolutionary Computation Conference, 414-424.
